com.revolsys.io.xml

Class StaxXmlWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revolsys.io.xml.StaxXmlWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XMLStreamWriter

    public class StaxXmlWriter
extends Object
implements XMLStreamWriter
    The StaxXmlWriter is a wrapper around an XmlWriter that implements the XMLStreamWriter interface from the StAX API.
    Author:
    Paul Austin

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws XMLStreamException

        Close this writer and free any resources associated with the writer. Note: this underlying writer closes the stream so this method breaks from the StAX specification which says it must not close te underlying output stream.

        Specified by:
        close in interface XMLStreamWriter
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - If an exception writing the XML occurs.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws XMLStreamException
        Write any cached data to the underlying output mechanism.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface XMLStreamWriter
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - If an exception writing the XML occurs.

      • writeCData

        public void writeCData(String text)
                throws XMLStreamException
        Write the contents in a CDATA section. No escaping will be done on the data the text must not contain "]]>".
        Specified by:
        writeCData in interface XMLStreamWriter
        Parameters:
        text - The text to wrap in a CDATA section
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - If there was a problem writing the text

      • writeCharacters

        public void writeCharacters(char[] buffer,
                   int offset,
                   int length)
                     throws XMLStreamException
        Write a portion of the character buffer to the outpu, escaping special characters.
        Specified by:
        writeCharacters in interface XMLStreamWriter
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to write.
        offset - The starting offset in the buffer.
        length - The number of characters to write.
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - If there was a problem writing the text.

      • writeDTD

        public void writeDTD(String dtd)
              throws XMLStreamException
        Write a DTD section. This string represents the entire doctypedecl production from the XML 1.0 specification.
        Specified by:
        writeDTD in interface XMLStreamWriter
        Parameters:
        dtd - The DTD to be written
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - If there was a problem writing the declaration
